00001 ######################################################################
00002 ##
00003 ##  Functions for creating tables of various kinds
00004 ##
00005 ##    ColumnTable()           Creates a two-column display in HTML,
00006 ##                            but only one column in TeX.
00007 ##
00008 ##    ColumnMatchTable()      Does a side-by-side match table
00009 ##
00010 ##    BeginTable()            Begin a borderless HTML table
00011 ##    Row()                   Create a row in the table
00012 ##    AlignedRow()            Create a row with alignment in each column
00013 ##    TableSpace()            Insert extra vertical space in the table
00014 ##    EndTable()              End the table
00015 ##
00016 
00017 sub _unionTables_init {}; # don't reload this file
00018 
00019 =head2 unionTables.pl 
00020 
00021  ######################################################################
00022  #
00023  #  Make a two-column table in HTML and Latex2HTML modes
00024  #
00025  #  Usage:  ColumnTable(col1,col2,[options])
00026  #
00027  #  Options can be taken from:
00028  #
00029  #      indent => n           the width to indent the first column
00030  #                            (default is 0)
00031  #
00032  #      separation => n       the width of the separating gutter
00033  #                            (default is 50)
00034  #
00035  #      valign => type        set the vertical alignment
00036  #                            (default is "MIDDLE")
00037  #
00038  
00039 =cut
00040 
00041 sub ColumnTable {
00042   my $col1 = shift; my $col2 = shift;
00043   my %options = (indent => 0, separation => 50, valign => "MIDDLE", @_);
00044   my ($ind,$sep) = ($options{"indent"},$options{"separation"});
00045   my $valign = $options{"valign"};
00046 
00047   my ($bhtml,$ehtml) = ('\begin{rawhtml}','\end{rawhtml}');
00048   ($bhtml,$ehtml) = ('','') unless ($displayMode eq "Latex2HTML");
00049 
00050   my $HTMLtable = qq {
00051     $bhtml<TABLE BORDER="0"><TR VALIGN="$valign">
00052     <TD WIDTH="$ind">&nbsp;</TD><TD>$ehtml
00053     $col1
00054     $bhtml</TD><TD WIDTH="$sep">&nbsp;</TD><TD>$ehtml
00055     $col2
00056     $bhtml</TD></TR></TABLE>$ehtml
00057   };
00058 
00059   MODES(
00060     TeX => '\par\medskip\hbox{\qquad\vtop{'.
00061        '\advance\hsize by -3em '.$col1.'}}'.
00062            '\medskip\hbox{\qquad\vtop{'.
00063            '\advance\hsize by -3em '.$col2.'}}\medskip',
00064     Latex2HTML => $HTMLtable,
00065     HTML => $HTMLtable
00066   );
00067 }
00068 
00069 =pod
00070 
00071  #
00072  #  Use columns for a match-list output
00073  #
00074  #  Usage:  ColumnMatchTable($ml,options)
00075  #
00076  #  where $ml is a math list reference and options are those
00077  #  allowed for ColumnTable above.
00078  #
00079 =cut
00080 
00081 sub ColumnMatchTable {
00082   my $ml = shift;
00083 
00084   ColumnTable($ml->print_q,$ml->print_a,@_);
00085 }
00086 
00087 =pod 
00088 
00089  #
00090  #  Command for tables with no borders.
00091  #
00092  #  Usage:  BeginTable(options);
00093  #
00094  #  Options are taken from:
00095  #
00096  #    border => n           value for BORDER attribute (default 0)
00097  #    spacing => n          value for CELLSPACING attribute (default 0)
00098  #    padding => n          value for CELLPADDING attribute (default 0)
00099  #    tex_spacing => dimen  value for spacing between columns in TeX
00100  #                          (e.g, tex_spacing => 2em) (default 1em)
00101  #    tex_border => dimen   value for left- and right border in TeX (0pt)
00102  #    center => 0 or 1      center table or not (default 1)
00103  #
00104 
00105 =cut
00106 
00107 sub BeginTable {
00108   my %options = (border => 0, padding => 0, spacing => 0, center => 1,
00109                  tex_spacing => "1em", tex_border => "0pt", @_);
00110   my ($bd,$pd,$sp) = ($options{border},$options{padding},$options{spacing});
00111   my ($tsp,$tbd) = ($options{tex_spacing},$options{tex_border});
00112   my ($center,$tcenter) = (' ALIGN="CENTER"','\centerline');
00113      ($center,$tcenter) = ('','') if (!$options{center});
00114   my $table = 
00115     qq{<TABLE BORDER="$bd" CELLPADDING="$pd" CELLSPACING="$sp"$center>};
00116 
00117   MODES(
00118     TeX => '\par\medskip'.$tcenter.'{\kern '.$tbd.
00119            '\vbox{\halign{#\hfil&&\kern '.$tsp.' #\hfil',
00120     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.$table.$eHTML."\n",
00121     HTML => $table."\n"
00122   );
00123 }
00124 
00125 =pod
00126 
00127  #
00128  #  Usage:  EndTable(options)
00129  #
00130  #  where options are taken from:
00131  #
00132  #     tex_border => dimen     extra vertical space in TeX mode (default 0pt)
00133  #
00134 
00135 =cut
00136 
00137 sub EndTable {
00138   my %options = (tex_border => "0pt", @_);
00139   my $tbd = $options{tex_border};
00140   MODES(
00141     TeX => '\cr}}\kern '.$tbd.'}\medskip'."\n",
00142     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.'</TABLE>'.$eHTML."\n",
00143     HTML => '</TABLE>'."\n"
00144   );
00145 }
00146 
00147 =pod
00148 
00149  #
00150  #  Creates a row in the table
00151  #
00152  #  Usage:  Row([item1,item2,...],options);
00153  #
00154  #  Each item appears as a separate entry in the table.
00155  #
00156  #  Options control how the row is displayed:
00157  #
00158  #    indent => num           Specifies size of blank column on the left
00159  #                            (default:  indent => 0)
00160  #
00161  #    separation => num       Specifies separation of columns
00162  #                            (default:  spearation => 30)
00163  #
00164  #    tex_vspace => "dimen"   Specifies additional vertical spacing for TeX
00165  #
00166  #    align => "type"         Specifies alignment of initial column
00167  #                            (default:  align => "LEFT")
00168  #
00169  #    valign => "type"        Specified vertical alignment of row
00170  #                            (default:  valign => "MIDDLE")
00171  #
00172  
00173 =cut
00174 
00175 sub Row {
00176   my $rowref = shift; my @row = @{$rowref};
00177   my %options = (
00178      indent => 0, separation => 30,
00179      align => "LEFT", valign => "MIDDLE",
00180      @_
00181   );
00182   my ($cind,$csep) = ($options{indent},$options{separation});
00183   my ($align,$valign) = ($options{align},$options{valign});
00184   my $sep = '<TD WIDTH="'.$csep.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $sep = '' if ($csep < 1);
00185   my $ind = '<TD WIDTH="'.$cind.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $ind = '' if ($cind < 1);
00186   my $fill = '';
00187   $fill = '\hfil' if (uc($align) eq "CENTER");
00188   $fill = '\hfill' if (uc($align) eq "RIGHT");
00189   my $vspace = '';
00190   $vspace = '\noalign{\vskip '.$options{tex_vspace}.'}' if $options{tex_vspace};
00191 
00192   MODES(
00193     TeX => '\cr'.$vspace."\n". $fill . join('& ',@row),
00194     Latex2HTML =>
00195       $bHTML."<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">".$eHTML .
00196       join($bHTML."</TD>$sep<TD>".$eHTML,@row) .
00197       $bHTML.'</TD></TR>'.$eHTML."\n",
00198     HTML => "<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">" .
00199       join("</TD>$sep<TD>",@row) . '</TD></TR>'."\n"
00200   );
00201 }
00202 
00203 =pod 
00204 
00205  #
00206  #  AlignedRow([item1,item2,...],options);
00207  #
00208  #  Options control how the row is displayed:
00209  #
00210  #    indent => num           Specifies size of blank column on the left
00211  #                            (default:  indent => 0)
00212  #
00213  #    separation => num       Specifies separation of columns
00214  #                            (default:  spearation => 30)
00215  #
00216  #    tex_vspace => "dimen"   Specifies additional vertical spacing for TeX
00217  #
00218  #    align => "type"         Specifies alignment of all columns
00219  #                            (default:  align => "CENTER")
00220  #
00221  #    valign => "type"        Specified vertical alignment of row
00222  #                            (default:  valign => "MIDDLE")
00223  #
00224  
00225 =cut
00226 
00227 sub AlignedRow {
00228   my $rowref = shift; my @row = @{$rowref};
00229   my %options = (
00230      indent => 0, separation => 30,
00231      align => "CENTER", valign => "MIDDLE",
00232      @_
00233   );
00234   my ($cind,$csep) = ($options{indent},$options{separation});
00235   my ($align,$valign) = ($options{align},$options{valign});
00236   my $sep = '<TD WIDTH="'.$csep.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $sep = '' if ($csep < 1);
00237   my $ind = '<TD WIDTH="'.$cind.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $ind = '' if ($cind < 1);
00238   my $fill = '';
00239   $fill = '\hfil ' if (uc($align) eq "CENTER");
00240   $fill = '\hfill ' if (uc($align) eq "RIGHT");
00241   my $vspace = '';
00242   $vspace = '\noalign{\vskip '.$options{tex_vspace}.'}' if $options{tex_vspace};
00243 
00244   MODES(
00245     TeX => '\cr'.$vspace."\n". $fill . join('&'.$fill,@row),
00246     Latex2HTML =>
00247       $bHTML."<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">".$eHTML .
00248       join($bHTML."</TD>$sep<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">".$eHTML,@row) .
00249       $bHTML.'</TD></TR>'.$eHTML."\n",
00250     HTML => "<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">" .
00251       join("</TD>$sep<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">",@row) . '</TD></TR>'."\n"
00252   );
00253 }
00254 
00255 =pod 
00256 
00257  #
00258  #  Add extra space between rows of a table
00259  #
00260  #  Usage:  TableSpace(pixels,points)
00261  #
00262  #  where pixels is the number of pixels of space in HTML mode and
00263  #  points is the number of points to use in TeX mode.
00264  #
00265 
00266 =cut
00267 
00268 sub TableSpace {
00269   my $rsep = shift;
00270   my $tsep = shift;
00271   $rsep = $tsep if (defined($tsep) && $main::displayMode eq "TeX");
00272   return "" if ($rsep < 1);
00273   MODES(
00274     TeX => '\vadjust{\kern '.$rsep.'pt}' . "\n",
00275     Latex2HTML =>
00276       $bHTML.'<TR><TD HEIGHT="'.$rsep.'"><!></TD></TR>'.$eHTML."\n",
00277     HTML => '<TR><TD HEIGHT="'.$rsep.'"></TD></TR>'."\n",
00278   );
00279 }
00280 
00281 =pod
00282 
00283  #
00284  #  A horizontal rule within a table.  (Could have been a variable,
00285  #  but all the other table commands are subroutines, so kept it
00286  #  one to be consistent.)
00287  #
00288 
00289 =cut
00290 
00291 sub TableLine {
00292   MODES(
00293     TeX => '\vadjust{\kern2pt\hrule\kern2pt}',
00294     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.
00295       '<TR><TD COLSPAN="10"><HR NOSHADE SIZE="1"></TD></TR>'.
00296       $eHTML."\n",
00297     HTML =>'<TR><TD COLSPAN="10"><HR NOSHADE SIZE="1"></TD></TR>'."\n"
00298   );
00299 }
